comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
You would like mRemoteNG to extract the information from the connection file? 

This is generally considered leaking data, especially since mRemoteNG does not yet have proper encryption on the connection file. See #2420, and #2189. 

Anyway, if you really would like this feature you can help yourself with the guide of this comment here: https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/2193#issuecomment-1146343983

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: this could be added with few restrictions, as per new connection profile (not release yet) we don't store passwords in mR anymore due mentioned potential data leak, and passwords are encoded and encrypted in connection profile what could be on the different location (db, shared drive, cloud, cyberark etc.) so you will be allow (if setting is not enabled - copy protection) clone connection data but in regards copy password to expose it I have doubts

comments.author: CMAPTu
comments.snippet:
As a simple workaround, you can create External tool entry "password to clipboard":

`cmd /Q /C "MODE 30,5 && echo %PASSWORD%| clip && TIMEOUT /T 10 /NOBREAK && echo off | clip"`

It copies password to clipboard for 5 sec and then erase it. The only problem is special symbols in passwords like redirect (<,>), slashes and etc.
